channel.title: Shell - David Vargas
channel.description: Different Linux Shells Bourne-again shell (Bash) C shell (csh/tcsh) Korn Shell (ksh) Z shell (zsh) View your systemâ€™s hostname by running the hostname command: hostname2 types of commands - internal (~30 built in commands) (builtins) - External - reside in individual files - usually binary programs or scripts - shellusys PATH variable to find the command (the executable file) Quoting Double quotes - text in between is regular characters - except $ \ `
